167976.title: The Black Hand
167976.plot: Two gang members send a threatening letter to a butcher, demanding money if he did not want his shop to be destroyed and his daughter Maria kidnapped. When he is unable to meet their request, they take Maria away. The Black Hand is the earliest surviving gangster film.

178714.title: San Francisco: Aftermath of Earthquake
178714.plot: Footage shot not long after the 1906 earthquake in San Francisco is edited together so that more than one scene and more than one vantage are included. We see fire raging. We see burned-out buildings, piles of rubble, and buildings with only one wall standing. People stand and watch; others walk purposely through the debris. A carriage passes; the camera pans the desolation. A horse-drawn cart is laden with a family's remaining possessions. A sign hangs outside one building: "A little disfigured but still in business. Men Wanted."

180140.title: A Visit to Peek Frean and Co.'s Biscuit Works
180140.plot: A look at typical activities taking place in the Peek Frean factory: First, the workers get up steam, as supplies of milk and flour arrive. Sheets of dough are rolled, then cut, shaped, and readied for baking. The camera then continues to show further events throughout the work day.

183938.title: Return of T.R.H. the Prince and Princess of Wales

183952.title: A Lively Quarter-Day
183952.plot: A conjurer makes furniture return from the bailiff's.

183956.title: Is Spiritualism a Fraud?: The Medium Exposed
183956.plot: Men expose a fake medium's tricks and take revenge.

185220.title: Revolution in Russia
185220.plot: A dramatization of the uprising in Odessa, Russia in 1905: A ship's crew, tired of being mistreated, mutinies and takes over their ship. When they reach land, a sailor who died during the mutiny is made a martyr, inspiring an uprising in the city. Then the authorities decide to repress the revolt with a brutal show of force.

185223.title: Aladdin and His Wonder Lamp
185223.plot: The legend of Aladdin and his magic lamp: Aladdin finds a magic lamp which brings him wealth, luxury, and marriage to a princess. But his rival, an evil magician, steals the lamp for himself. Aladdin must regain the lamp or lose everything.

191595.title: The Impossible Convicts
191595.plot: Four prisoners, in convicts' stripes, march backwards down stairs and, under the watchful eyes of guards, hop backwards into their cells. Later, one overpowers a guard and springs his three pals. But, will they be able to pull off an escape? Other guards come to the aid of their fallen comrade before all four felons can flee. Guards and convicts spring forward and backward out of cells, up and down stairs, and into and out of freedom.

196199.title: In the Family Garden
196199.plot: A short film from Slovenia made by Karol Grossmann.

196287.title: A Funny Shave
196287.plot: A man is trying to shave, but grotesque faces keep appearing in his mirror.

196338.title: Punch and Judy
196338.plot: A group of people watches a guignol (the French version of a Punch and Judy show). Outtake from a longer, now lost, film.

196339.title: Army Pack Train Bringing Supplies
196339.plot: A troop of soldiers on horseback enter San Francisco with relief supplies following the earthquake that year.

196340.title: The Life Guards on Amager
196340.plot: Danish film has three dancers from the Danish Royal Ballet doing what they do best: dancing.

196342.title: The Icelandic Althing Visits Copenhagen
196342.plot: Long winded film runs just over six-minutes but we're pretty much shown Iceland's Parliament as they board a ship and are given a reception by the Danish crown.

196343.title: Zigeunerdans af troubaduren
196343.plot: Another Danish film from director Peter Elfelt, this one here pretty much just showing a woman doing an gypsy dance for 59-seconds.

196344.title: Films of the San Francisco Earthquake
196344.plot: Robert K. Bonine documents the destruction of the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

196345.title: Three American Beauties
196345.plot: In this color-tinted short, we first see a close-up of a red rose, perfectly formed. Then, we see the rose held by a young woman who is wearing a bright yellow dress. She's the second beauty. Behind her is a slow dissolve to the US flag, tinted in red, white, and blue, blowing in the wind. Behind the flag is a star-lit sky.

196346.title: Holmenkollen Ski Jump
196346.plot: Danish filmmaker Peter Elfelt took his camera to the bottom of the slopes at the skiing competition in Norway. At the bottom of the slope the director captured the man finishing off their jumps.

196347.title: Exploded Gas Tanks, U.S. Mint, Emporium and Spreckels' Bldg.
196347.plot: The camera scrolls through a landscape to reveal the aftermath of a huge gas explosion.

196348.title: Tartans of Scottish Clans
196348.plot: It's common knowledge that Scotsmen are macho enough to pull off wearing a skirt - perhaps it's all that caber-tossing. This disarmingly simple film concentrates on the tartan cloths of various clans rather than the men who wore them, and is an early filmic reminder of their huge importance to both Scottish national identity and the thriving tourist industry north of the border.  The film's unique selling point was that pioneering filmmaker G. A. Smith showed off the vibrant designs in Kinemacolor, among the earliest colour film processes that didn't involve meticulous hand-painting. And no dangly bits in sight.

196352.title: Flying the Foam and Some Fancy Diving
196352.plot: Self-styled pier entertainer 'Professor' Reddish was a specialist in the "flying the foam" stunt, which involved mounting a bicycle and riding it down a steep ramp and then off the end of Brighton's West Pier into the sea. (BFI)

196371.title: The Butterflies
196371.plot: In a Japanese garden, gather maidens with nets to catch butterflies, all in the joy of life and budding maidenhood; fresh Irish sweetness of blithe Spring; the light fantastic toe "tripping" the limpid music arranged for this unique piece of art in a large cage a pretty colored butterfly is brought in, to delight the winsome maidens, who execute a pretty umbrella dance ere the poor butterflies are forced to entertain the merry group. Scenes are passed and the pretty butterfly is imprisoned again in the cage.

196376.title: The Rajah's Casket
196376.plot: An evil magician visits the rajah's palace to perform his magic tricks, but he also steals a valuable casket making his getaway aboard a dragon. The rajah pursues the wizard to a subterranean cavern.

196377.title: A Winter Straw Ride
196377.plot: Two groups of young women get into a pair of horse-drawn carts, and go off for a straw ride through the snowy streets. As they pass by a group of children, the children throw snowballs at the riders, and they and other persons begin to join in the fun. Then one of the carts tips on its side, spilling some of its occupants into the snow. Everyone soon decides that they enjoy playing in the snow even more than riding.

196379.title: The Magician from Arabia
196379.plot: A sorcerer draws signs on the sand making charming young women.

196380.title: Wales v. Ireland at Wrexham
196380.plot: A film from the UK based Mitchell & Kenyon.

196384.title: Miniature Theatre
196384.plot: Three young children set up a table, and on the table is placed a miniature stage. The stage curtain opens, a carpet appears, and then the carpet unrolls by itself. Two puppet figures then come out and begin to perform a series of routines.

196386.title: Kathleen Mavourneen
196386.plot: Captain Clearfield, a wealthy landlord, assaults Kathleen with the help of an accomplice, but Terence O'More arrives in time to break up the attack. Clearfield then tries to get his way by intimidating Kathleen and her father, but again help arrives in time. Clearfield and his accomplice then come up with their most violent plan yet.

196388.title: A Roadside Inn
196388.plot: The staff of an inn play a cruel trick on a guest.

196391.title: A Mix-Up in the Gallery
196391.plot: A photographer has an accident which not only screws up his lab but dumps a great deal of debris into the street below, causing general chaos.

196393.title: The Terrible Kids
196393.plot: Two boys and their dog set out to play a series of practical jokes on their neighbors. After they have caused several disruptions, the police are called, and soon the boys are on the run, pursued by the police and others. In their efforts to escape, the boys receive considerable help from the resourceful dog.

196394.title: Tit-for-Tat
196394.plot: An entomologist guilty of trying to capture rare insects is condemned to be pinned on a giant cork.

196395.title: From Leadville to Aspen: A Hold-Up in the Rockies
196395.plot: A train traveling through the Rockies is held up and boarded by two thugs. They rob the wealthy occupants at gunpoint and then make their getaway by handcar. From there, they hijack a horsecart on a road running parallel to the tracks. Will justice prevail in the end?

196396.title: The Witch
196396.plot: A penniless troubadour consults witch Carabosse about his future, but offends her by paying with a bag of sand. He evades the witch's revenge, and saves the beautiful princess.

196400.title: The Bewitched Shepherd
196400.plot: A young peasant leaves his cottage after a quarrel with his wife, and meets a witch. She takes him to a cavern, where after a series of encounters with goblins and other elusive creatures, he is presented with a choice of beautiful women of various races. Finally the witch makes his wife appear.

196402.title: The Tramp and the Mattress Makers
196402.plot: A bum accidentally gets himself sewn up inside a mattress.

196404.title: A Desperate Crime
196404.plot: A man is murdered and the killer brought to justice by guillotine. This film is partly lost.

196406.title: Jack the Chimney Sweep
196406.plot: Jack is taken on a sea-snail to the lair of a fairy, who magically turns him into a prince. He thoroughly enjoys the dancing and fawning of the court. Then he wakes up, and it turns out that he's an ordinary chimney sweep.

196407.title: The Luny Musician
196407.plot: A crazy, rude musician gets some supernatural comeuppance.

196408.title: Getting Evidence
196408.plot: A jealous husband arrives in the office of Hawkshaw, a private detective. The husband is certain that his wife is being unfaithful, and he wants the detective to produce photographic evidence. The detective tails the wife, and thinks he has caught her, but a sudden mishap prevents him from getting a photo. Despite this and further setbacks, the dedicated detective presses on, determined to fulfill his assignment.

196488.title: Bathing Forbidden
196488.plot: Three young women are smiling and playing in a lake, their nude bodies reflecting in the water, when a forest watcher appears from the wood, and chases them away. They get out of the water, pick their clothes from tree branches, and move away before putting them on. The bearded man seems to be shy, but he is chasing after them through the wood, anyway.

20105.title: The Story of the Kelly Gang
20105.plot: Just as Galeen and Wegener's Der Golem (1915) can be seen as a  testament to early German film artistry, The Story of the Kelly Gang (1906) symbolizes both the birth of the Australian film industry and the emergence of an Australian cinema identity. Even more significantly, it heralds the emergence of the feature film format. However, only fragments of the original production of more than one hour are known to exist, preserved at the National Film and Sound Archive, Canberra; Efforts at reconstruction have made the film available to modern audiences.

205008.title: Deadly Idyll
205008.plot: Young lovers separate, she to a career on the stage and he to remain in the small village in which they grew up. Years pass and he is hired to be a porter for a theater company and finds her, a far different woman who does not recognize him.

205009.title: Poor Mother
205009.plot: A woman loses her only child. She turns to drink and begins to hallucinate an image of her beloved child.

205264.title: The Fairy of Spring
205264.plot: A beautiful minimalist string score accompanies this sweet little film. A couple bring an old lady into their home to help her shelter from the thick falling snow, but it turns out to be a fairy who grants them a wish. This uses some effective reverse photography and the simple story works well.

217784.title: Little Tich
217784.plot: His most popular routine was his Big Boot dance, which involved a pair of 28-inch boots, commonly called "slapshoes" in the days of vaudeville.

232297.title: Arrival of Emigrants, Ellis Island
232297.plot: Immigrants and boats departing and arriving at Ellis Island.

232299.title: Skyscrapers
232299.plot: A new skyscraper is being built in New York City, and numerous workmen are busy at hazardous jobs high above the ground. When one of the workers, Dago Pete, deliberately starts a fight, he is immediately fired. But the discharged worker soon comes up with a plan to commit a robbery and get even. His scheme could affect the lives of several others.

232301.title: San Francisco Disaster
232301.plot: This pseudo-newsreel uses special effects to illustrate the fire caused by the San Francisco earthquake. A miniature model of downtown San Francisco is set ablaze and filmed.

232302.title: Society Ballooning, Pittsfield, Mass.
232302.plot: At the beginning of the film, a group of men can be seen gathered around a flat area near a large municipal gas tank. Most of the group are attending to the skin of a big balloon in the foreground near the camera. The remainder of the film shows the balloon being filled with gas until it is buoyant enough to become airborne, the mounting of the suspended basket, the release of the balloon, and the actual flight. The balloon was the Centaur.

232306.title: Electric Current
232306.plot: A couple steals food from a grocery store. To stop them from repeating their crime, the cunning salesman electrifies his shop.

232308.title: Voyage autour d'une étoile
232308.plot: An old astronomer has been transfixed by a star for a long time. He had but one thought: to travel to it, to declare his love for it! But how? A simple but ingenious solution-- A giant bubble. Velle remade the film for Italian studio Cines in the same year.

232310.title: The Invisible Men
232310.plot: A scientist concocts a potion that can turn people invisible for short periods of time.  Two crooks steal the potion and go on a crime spree.

232570.title: Logging in Maine
232570.plot: The subject is the movement of cut timber from the forest to the mill. The few scenes that make up the film are loggers performing the various operations necessary to prevent logs from jamming together. The men keep them headed with the flow of the water toward the lake on which the mill is located. The activities of approximately a dozen men were photographed.

232575.title: Living Flowers
232575.plot: Gaston Velle's 'Les Fleurs Animées' was screened by the Australian-based Corrick Family Entertainers as part of their variety act. In their advertising the Corricks described the detailed, hand-coloured production as 'The finest "Color" Film of the Twentieth Century'. Simple camera tricks create a magic fairy story in this tale of angry flowers exacting revenge on a man who has wantonly destroyed their garden.

232577.title: Anna, what are you waiting for?
232577.plot: Modern Americans think that the movies learned to talk in 1927 when Al Jolson opened his mouth in THE JAZZ SINGER, but sound pictures had a much longer history. Edison envisaged combining the phonograph with motion pictures even before they had been perfected and there is a test sequence from 1895. By the time this 'phonoscene' had been made, Alice Guy had been directing a series of them and there was a series in production in Germany, too. Yet true synchronization remained a problem, what with records wearing out and film breaking until the perfection of sound on film itself.

232578.title: L'Obsession de l'or
232578.plot: An artist is painting the portrait of a young woman dressed in a country costume in his attic studio. The landlord demands the rent, but the artist has no money. The model tries to comfort him, but he throws her out. Dancing safes appear and he takes bags of gold coins out of them. A woman fairy appears and she transports them to a palace. Soldiers march in and a troupe of women dancers perform. The artist's model attempts to pawn her jewelry to help pay the rent. A rain of what appears to be fire begins to fall and the artist awakens in his studio, bent on suicide.

232581.title: The Joe Gans-Battling Nelson Fight
232581.plot: A championship fight that took place in the Nevada goldfields between boxers Joe Gans and Battling Nelson.

232582.title: The Pigeon Fairy
232582.plot: A beautiful seductive fairy makes gentle winged creatures appear.

232583.title: Holger Drachmann
232583.plot: A short clip showing Holger Drachmann.

232584.title: Holdup of the Rocky Mountain Express
232584.plot: An early film drama shot on an actual railroad line in Phoenicia, NY in the Catskills.

232586.title: Christian IXS bisættelse
232586.plot: Christian IX (b. 1818) died 29 January 1906. He was king of Denmark for 42 years. With his many family ties to the royal houses of Europe, he was known as 'Europe's father-in-law'. After castrum doloris in Christiansborg church, the coffin was transported by train to Roskilde cathedral, where Danish monarchs are laid to rest.

232587.title: Orfeus og Eurydike
232587.plot: Dance from the opera from 1762 by Christoph Willibad Gluck (1714-1787), choreography by Hans Beck 1896. Performed by Valborg Borchsenius (née Guldbrandsen), Ellen Price, Elisabeth Beck (1865-1946) and Anna Marie Agerholm (1875-1929).

232589.title: Enkekejserinde Dagmars Ankomst
232589.plot: Empress Dowager Dagmar's arrival in Copenhagen with several members of the royal family present.

232590.title: The Anarchist's Mother-in-Law
232590.plot: The Anarchist's Mother-in-Law premiered on October 23, 1906. It featured director Viggo Larsen as the anarchist and Margrethe Jespersen  as his wife. The movie is about a mother-in-law disturbing the house peace.

232620.title: Human Apes from the Orient
232620.plot: The subject is two grotesque-looking human beings who are sitting on the deck of a ship. The two weird individuals sit cross-legged and do the bidding of a man in oriental costume. The point of the film seems to be directed at the fact that the bone structure of the two subjects makes them look like monkeys or apes, and the spectators seem to be trying to get them to behave like monkeys, that is, scratch themselves, etc.

232660.title: King Haakon's Visit to 'Dannenbrog' at Crown Prince Christian's Abode
232660.plot: King Haakon on the boat of Crown Prince Christian.

232661.title: Kong Haakons og Dronning Mauds Besøg i Danmark
232661.plot: King Haakon and Queen Maud visit Denmark.

232662.title: Lerfossen
232662.plot: View of the Lerfossen near Trondhjem.

232668.title: Kongerevue 1906
232668.plot: The 1906 version of the Kongerevue parade in Denmark.

232674.title: Kong Haakons besøg paa 'Herluf Trolle'
232674.plot: King Haakon visits the battleship 'Herluf Trolle'

232676.title: The Proclamation of King Frederik VIII
232676.plot: The shift of the crown was paralleled by a new epoch of cinema in Denmark. Peter Elfelt had been the dominant figure in early Danish film. After some rather insignificant films, Ole Olsen founded the success of Nordisk Films Kompagni upon this film and 'The Funeral of King Christian IX'.

232680.title: Dynamiting Ruins and Rescuing Soldiers Caught in the Fallen Walls
232680.plot: Scenes of the aftermath of the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

232681.title: Prinsen og Prinsessen af Wales' Ankomst til Trondhjem
232681.plot: The Prince and Princess of Wales visit Trondhjem, Norway.

232684.title: Kong Haakon og Dronning Mauds Indtog i Trondhjem
232684.plot: King Haakon and Queen Maud in Trondhjem.

232685.title: The King and Queen Drive Between Kroningen and Trondheim Cathedral on 22 June 1906
232685.plot: The King and Queen travels to and from Trondhjems Domkirke.

232689.title: The King's Visit to Aarhus on 1. September 1906

232691.title: King Frederik VIII and Kristiania
232691.plot: Kong Frederik VIII of Denmark vists Kristiania (aka Oslo) in 1906.

232713.title: The Charmer
232713.plot: A magician charms a caterpillar and turns it into a butterfly woman.

232723.title: The Hand of the Artist
232723.plot: Animated film featuring the hand of Walter R. Booth drawing a coster and his donah who come to life and dance. The hand then crumples up the paper and dispenses it in the form of confetti. (BFI)

232740.title: Zachariæs Selskab
232740.plot: People traveling by horse carriage to a party.

237871.title: Fiskerliv i Norden
237871.plot: A story of fisherman's life in the north and how they get trapped at sea.

257556.title: I Fetch the Bread
257556.plot: A family sends a man out for some bread. Instead, he seems to be trying to find every drink in Paris. Another man goes out after him, but does the same. They both return, utterly drunk.

284394.title: The 100 to One Shot; or, A Run of Luck
284394.plot: A farmer facing foreclosure goes to the city and bets everything on a horse race. When he wins he goes back to the country in an expensive car and prevents the landlord from evicting his parents.

285235.title: The Missing Legacy; or, The Story of a Brown Hat
285235.plot: A man gives away an inherited hat, then finds it contains a will.

292651.title: How a British Bulldog Saved the Union Jack
292651.plot: A British soldier is made prisoner by a Zulu, who tries to set fire on the Union Jack. A bulldog runs on the rescue terrorizing the Zulu. This allows the soldier to free himself from the rope, to burn the kraal and to save the Union Jack.

317951.title: How the Office Boy Saw the Ball Game
317951.plot: An office boy plays hooky from work so he can watch a ballgame perched high atop a telephone pole.  Includes footage of an actual baseball game as if seen through a telescope.

318886.title: A Trip to Berkeley, Cal
318886.plot: In the beginning of the film, a streetcar passes in front of the camera position. The camera starts to move, indicating that it was on a streetcar since it is in the same position as the car in the first scene. All the film was photographed from the streetcar.

318887.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 1
318887.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318888.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 2
318888.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318889.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 3
318889.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318890.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 4
318890.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318891.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 5
318891.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318892.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 6
318892.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318893.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 7
318893.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318894.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 8
318894.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318895.title: Epileptic Seizure, No. 9
318895.plot: This Walter G. Chase film about epileptic seizures was photographed from a single camera position against a backdrop of dark canvas.

318968.title: J'ai perdu mon lorgnon
318968.plot: A fat man has lost his glasses and runs into all types of problems trying to find them.

318969.title: Un jour de paye
318969.plot: A drunken man gets into a fight with everyone he meets.

321832.title: The Wrestler's Wife
321832.plot: A story of a desperate wife who worries about her husband, a career wrestler.

321833.title: Drame passionnel
321833.plot: A man and a woman meet in a park in Paris and fall in love with each other. Four years later, they have a daughter, but the man is bored and decides to break. He disappears, but the woman finds by chance that he is about to marry for money. She prepares to get revenge.

321834.title: L'Âge du cœur
321834.plot: This film tells the story of mésalliance. He is old and she's young. She takes a lover. He wants to get revenge.

321837.title: La fille du sonneur
321837.plot: An old man, bell ringer at Notre Dame de Paris, disowns his daughter who has an affair with a young frivolous gentleman.

334788.title: Panoramic View of Market Street San Francisco After the Earthquake and Fire
334788.plot: A panoramic view of Market Street San Francisco after the earthquake and fire of 1906

341423.title: København Paa Kryds Og Tværs
341423.plot: A view of Copenhagen primarily from the perspective of a sea traveler.

341424.title: Kong Haakon VII's Ankomst Til København
341424.plot: The arrival of the Norwegian king in Copenhagen is documented in this early short film.

345813.title: Palatino Park
345813.plot: The activities of a recently opened amusement park in Havana, Cuba, similar to New York's Coney Island.

346724.title: Attempted Suicide
346724.plot: Suffering from unrequited love, Max hangs himself from a tree, and ends up hanging for hours while local townspeople squabble over whose responsibility it is to rescue him.

346967.title: Fun After the Wedding
346967.plot: A delightful and typical farce film, ending with the usual Gallic chase.

349117.title: Lilliputian Dance
349117.plot: A basket of flowers appears and moves by itself to the middle of a decorative arch. From the basket, a woman magician appears. From a cylinder, the magician conjures a series of tiny dancers and acrobats who perform on a table top, and in the palm of her hand. (Library of Congress) Possibly created by Segundo de Chomón.

354149.title: Photographie d'une étoile
354149.plot: A photographer welcomes a theather actress into his studio for a glamor shoot.

355991.title: Rescued in Mid-Air
355991.plot: A car crash blows a lady with a parasol onto a steeple. An inventor with an airship comes to the rescue.

356518.title: The Marriage of Princess Ena and Alphonse XIII, King of Spain
356518.plot: A short film documenting the wedding ceremony of Princess Ena to King Alfonso XIII of Spain. Showing the royal carriage, the royal procession through the streets to the palace steps, etc.

356962.title: King Edward VII Launches HMS Dreadnought from Portsmouth Dockyard
356962.plot: Part of BFI collection "Tales From the Shipyard".

375553.title: A Detective's Tour Around The World
375553.plot: In a chase which literally encompasses the entire globe, a detective follows the path of an apparent embezzler through various foreign nations, exotic cultures and dangerous situations.

375557.title: Dogs used as smugglers
375557.plot: With contraband strapped to the backs of their dogs, smugglers set off to cross the Spanish-French border. Having been spied upon and betrayed to customs officers, a fierce skirmish results and only the dogs and a single smuggler reach their destination.

376287.title: The Life of a Cowboy
376287.plot: A cowboy gets involved in the kidnapping and rescue of a pretty young girl.

386785.title: Buona sera signorina Bonelli!
386785.plot: It was traditional for picture house screenings to begin with a short welcoming sketch, this one featured Lydia De Robertis writing Good Evening on a chalk board.

388576.title: Le matelas de la mariée
388576.plot: A man hides in a couch and is transported in it while causing havoc.

407779.title: Goodbye and Thank You
407779.plot: 1906 Pathe short film, english title "Goodbye and Thank You".

415554.title: A Tragic Wedding
415554.plot: A young woman becomes pregnant and attempts to provide for her child after the father leaves her.

415659.title: The Automobile Thieves
415659.plot: A young couple conducts a series of robberies, followed by a chase, in which they are shot and killed.

415660.title: The Captain of Köpenick
415660.plot: A short documentary based on Wilhelm Voigt.

417833.title: Le fils du diable fait la noce à Paris
417833.plot: When Hell gets boring, head for Paris.

417840.title: Les débuts d'un chauffeur
417840.plot: The proud owner of a new car in 1907 gets behind the wheel for the first time and weaves down the street, hitting everything from lamp-posts to market stalls and baby carriages. An ever-increasing crowd of incensed pursuers chases after him...

417847.title: Eine Fahrt durch Wien
417847.plot: A trip through Vienna on a tram.

418082.title: Earthquake Ruins, New Majestic Theatre and City Hall
418082.plot: A film by the Edison Company showing the devastation of the April 1906 earthquake in San Francisco.

426090.title: Departure from Palacio de Don Tomás Estrada Palma
426090.plot: Depicts the exit of the President of the Republic Tomás Estrada Palma from the Presidential Palace, after giving the government to the Secretary of War of the United States, William H. Taft. This was the start of the second US intervention on the island.

427313.title: Meißner Porzellan
427313.plot: Two statues come to live and start to sing.

429899.title: Ruins of Chinatown
429899.plot: Shows Chinatown in ruins after the 1906 earthquake.

429900.title: Vertical Panorama City Hall and Surroundings
429900.plot: Vertical panorama City Hall and surroundings after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

429901.title: Panorama, City Hall, Van Ness Avenue and College of St. Ignatius
429901.plot: Panorama, City Hall, Van Ness Avenue and College of St. Ignatius after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

429902.title: Panorama, Nob Hill and Ruins of Millionaire Residences
429902.plot: Panorama, Nob Hill and Ruins of Millionaire Residences after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

429903.title: Panorama, Ruins Aristocratic Apartments
429903.plot: Panorama, Ruins Aristocratic Apartments after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

429904.title: Panorama, Notorius 'Barbary Coast'
429904.plot: Panorama, Notorius 'Barbary Coast' after the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.

453171.title: Waiting at the Church
453171.plot: 1906 film by Edwin S. Porter, based on a popular song of the same title.

453761.title: Seeing Boston
453761.plot: In 1906 a cameraman boarded a streetcar in Boston and rode around the city, wherever that vehicle took him. The film is exceptional, because it shows Boston's public buildings, its squares and subway construction, as well as the large public library.

453805.title: Terrier vs. Wild Cat
453805.plot: This shows an arranged fight between a terrier and an alley cat. During the length of the film, the spectators harass the animals to a point where they are forced to attack one another.

460178.title: Play Ball on the Beach
460178.plot: Stage set with painted backdrop of ocean & pier. Two women in bathing suits with broom, one catches & other swings. They argue with man in bathing suit who is refereeing & then fight with him. One woman holds him and other beats him with broom. He then picks one woman up and they all fall down.

460309.title: Down In The Deep
460309.plot: A fisherman's dreams come through in sentcilcolor, featuring deep sea fairies, puppet seahorses, a bug-eyed octopus, and a colossal starfish. Zecca was Pathé's response to Melies.

465496.title: The Curate's Dilemma
465496.plot: A curate sits on an anthill at a picnic.

470783.title: Felling of Hibson Road Brick Works Chimney in Nelson
470783.plot: It is a dramatic film, with its colossal explosion and smouldering remains. Within seconds of the chimney's collapse, crowds swarm in to inspect the site; issues of the crowd's health and safety are clearly not a concern, as people smile, wave and salute the camera.

49272.title: The Mysterious Retort
49272.plot: A wizard sleeps at a table in his well-appointed sitting room. From a drawer in the table, a snake appears.

49277.title: The Hilarious Posters
49277.plot: A wall full of advertising posters comes to life.

482446.title: Bobby and His Family
482446.plot: A clown creates a giant version of his face, and then retrieves two miniature versions of himself from his luggage.

520793.title: Vienna by Tram
520793.plot: A tram ride through Vienna. Actuality of Pathe Freres.

520794.title: The Phantom Guard
520794.plot: A trick film by Gaston Velle

533112.title: Voyage original
533112.plot: Short film about a magic ride

533113.title: Hallucination musicale
533113.plot: Short film about a dreaming musician

536830.title: The Paymaster
536830.plot: A payroll clerk is framed by a man competing with him for the attentions of a mill girl.

537512.title: The Silver Wedding
537512.plot: Thieves plot to steal the gifts at a wedding.

537525.title: The Tunnel Workers
537525.plot: Two tunnel workers are fighting over the wife of one, who's also involved with the other. Suddenly an explosion occurs. Instead of fighting, they help each other escape.

539133.title: Le thermomètre de l'amour
539133.plot: A short comedy about a park bench with a Love's Thermometer on it.

580447.title: Flower Parade 1906
580447.plot: Flower Parade in Luxembourg City, July 15, 1906.

619899.title: Two Clowns
619899.plot: A male and female clown drink, smoke, and flirt in this early Kinemacolor short.

622695.title: Married for Millions
622695.plot: Early Biograph short on the results of marrying for financial gain.

632556.title: Un attentat sur la voie ferrée

638077.title: The Maids' Strike
638077.plot: An army of kitchen maids go on strike and take down all the men who come in their path.

690102.title: A New Hat for the Madam
690102.plot: A young woman is out shopping and buys a new hat in the latest fashion. Unfortunately, the hat is so huge that it leaves a trail of destruction wherever she goes. A quite ordinary stroll suddenly becomes deeply problematic.

696165.title: Frau Holle
696165.plot: A short film of the tale of Mother Holly.

697219.title: Douanier séduit
697219.plot: A bunch of peasants in their holiday best are trying to cross the border, but Homeland Security or whatever they call it is on guard. Should they shoot him before he can build a wall? No need! There's a pretty girl,p willing to go into his sentry box with with him.

697220.title: Douaniers et fraudeurs
697220.plot: Smugglers land their goods. Customs inspectors spot them and take off in pursuit.

697223.title: Kongebesøg i Aarhus 1906
697223.plot: This movie chronicling the visit of Frederick VIII to the city of Aarhus.

697224.title: La chaussette
697224.plot: A man dancing at a party finds one of his socks has fallen down. Retreating where no one can see him, he removes the offending item. the consequences are not long in coming in this very short -- two minutes -- comedy from Alice Guy.

697226.title: La vengeance du clerc de notaire
697226.plot: A notary's clerk and the cleaning woman play a trick on their employer. This earns the clerk a box on the ears. They up the stakes by writing letters that bring every hunchback, cripple and slob crowding into the office.

697228.title: Le billet de logement
697228.plot: Two soldiers appear at a private house and demand lodging.

697230.title: The Good Judge
697230.plot: A family living in poverty, in a tiny house with no furniture. When mama goes to sleep, the youngsters head out to rustle up some firewood. Apparently that's illegal, so some forest rangers seize them and the wood to bring to a well-dressed man.

697236.title: Une femme trop pressée
697236.plot: A man collapses while drinking a cup of coffee. His wife and their servant raise a hand and releases it. It drops imertly. He's dead. His worries are over. His suffering wife, however, must go through the wearying routine of dealing with his death alone.

697238.title: Victime des créanciers
697238.plot: Yes, I understand that everyone gets a little behind occasionally, but when the stout, well-dressed man is woken by his servant to deal with the creditors, I tend to be a bit more sympathetic to them than him. When they rise from the soup tureen to demand their just moneys, I wonder why he didn't sell the tureen and pay them. Even when they rise from the nether regions of the lavatory en masse.

697241.title: The Secret of Death Valley
697241.plot: A wife has a vision of her miner husband being killed at the site of his claim. She finds the murderer, now living in luxury, and exacts revenge.

697242.title: The Warwick Pageant
697242.plot: t's one of those pageants from history, in which Roman centurions fight caveman with halberds, Queen Elizabeth arrives in a carriage, and another queen gets her head chopped off while maidens in long, white gowns and crowns of daisies dance o'er the greensward. It looks, in short, like a Society for Creative Anachronism event, with someone footing the bill so all the Tower Warders' uniforms look the same.

699023.title: Un petit frère sous les choux
699023.plot: A family scene: father, mother, daughter and a baby in the crub. A doctor is visiting. The family is upset. In the next scene, everyone wears black, the crib is empty. Outside, a distraught woman wanders about and leaves her infant under a cabbage.

700304.title: Firefighting Exercise
700304.plot: This is the oldest preserved film recorded in Iceland. It shows from a firefighting exercise that took place in Reykjavík in 1906.

704256.title: Good Evening, the Flower Fairy
704256.plot: Early short film by Alice Guy.

709738.title: Les deux espiègles
709738.plot: Earliy short film with mischievous kids.

713355.title: Un coup de vent
713355.plot: "Alice Guy-Blaché liked Feuillade's scripts, and one of them, Le coup de vent, was filmed by Etienne Armaud in 1905. Two years later, Alice left Paris to follow her husband, who had just taken over the Berlin office of Gaumont, and she persuaded Gaumont to let Feuillade replace her. From 1907 he was in charge of hiring directors, buying scripts, choosing stars and at the same time directing his own films."  From Decades Never Start on Time: A Richard Roud Anthology

713365.title: Mais n'te promène donc pas toute nue

715436.title: La folie de Pierrot
715436.plot: When his woman walks out on him, the clown suffers from hallucinations, imagining various people and situations in his misery.

715518.title: Intercalated Games
715518.plot: Highlights of the Athens 1906 Olympic Games.

717768.title: And the Villain Still Pursued Her, or, the Author's Dream
717768.plot: A writer of tawdry fiction falls asleep at his desk and dreams of a romantic rivalry-- One likely as familiar to film fans then as it is now-- But things take a turn for the bizarre when our hero is shot in the head. An ambitious and hilarious parody of melodramatic tropes from pioneer Blackton.

724085.title: The River Ozu, Japan
724085.plot: Men in boats traveling along the Ozu River, sometimes getting out to walk on the gravel and pull the vessels along.

733298.title: Panoramic View of Waikiki Beach, Honolulu, H.I.
733298.plot: A panoramic view of Waikiki Beach.

733649.title: Kanaka Fishermen Casting the Throw Net, Hilo, H.I.

737424.title: Crowds Returning from the Games, Waikiki, Hawaiian Islands
737424.plot: A static shot of crowded trams returning people from an unknown sporting event.

737428.title: Panoramic View, Waikiki from an Electric Car, Hawaiian Islands

738638.title: Terrible Anguish
738638.plot: In all likeliness an inspiration for Griffith's The Lonely Villa (1909), Terrible Anguish tells the brief and tragic tale of a family being torn apart while the husband is away at work.

743449.title: Surf Scene, Waikiki, Honolulu, H.I.
743449.plot: The documentary features the oldest footage ever taken of surfing, and it was shot in Hawaii by Robert Bonine.

743451.title: Hauling Sugar Cane, Kohala Plantation, Hawaii
743451.plot: The title reads "Hailing Drags". You'd expect some sort of travois affair, but it turns out to be mules hailing sugar cane loaded onto wheeled flats. Considered the ground they are on is very rough, it helps.

743453.title: Hawaiians Arriving to Attend a Luau or Native Feast
743453.plot: A bunch of men on horseback gallop past people near a shack in this short shot by Robert K.Bonine.

743455.title: S.S. 'Kinau' Landing Passengers, Mahukona, Hawaii
743455.plot: There's no harbor, and the ship lies some distance off shore..... then the camera pans and a tender has to be sent out amidst the rough water.

743456.title: Arrival Mahukona Express, Kohala, Hawaii
743456.plot: The ramshackle-looking train on the single-track line pulls into the station, just in front of the siding. People clumb down and go on their ways.

743459.title: Shearing Sheep, Humuula Ranch, Hawaii
743459.plot: Shows how they cut the wool off of sheep.

743460.title: Washing Sheep, Humuula Beach, Hawaii
743460.plot: Shepherds in Hawaii push a flock of sheep in line through a trough of water.

753486.title: Motor Pirates
753486.plot: Crooks in an armored car-- the modern-day pirates-- trespass, murder and rob other motorists while sailing the roadways. Able to traverse small bodies of water in their craft, they evade police capture... for a time.

764860.title: Le déserteur
764860.plot: A soldier steals his officer's money and asks the music-hall singer he is mad about to run awy with him.

764863.title: La scuola di cavalleria in Pinerolo
764863.plot: This one-reel documentary is pretty much what it says in the title. Cavalrymen ride their horses, first over low hedges, then over increasingly rough terrain, until by the end they are sliding down hills to cross a stream and going into caves. The horses don't seem terribly anixous to do these things. Occasionally a rider falls off and the horse walks away, as if to say "See! I told you this wasn't a good idea."

777490.title: Scenes in San Francisco. [No. 1]
777490.plot: Views and pans among the ruins of San Francisco after the earthquake and fire.

777555.title: San Francisco After the Earthquake and Fire of 1906
777555.plot: This film is made up of five panoramas, four wide and one close-up, of the ruins of downtown San Francisco shortly after the 1906 disaster, plus a panorama and scene in a nearby refugee camp. Original intertitles precede each change of scene, but the locations provided are incorrect for three of the five views. The state of the ruins and camp suggest a date in late April, 1906. The absence of streetcar tracks in the "Grand Avenue" panorama dates that segment to before May 1, 1906.

777600.title: Voilà mon mari
777600.plot: Her husband goes away on a business trip. Her lover appears. However, before they can begin their affair, there is a knock on the door. He hides in a dirt chest. When the maid is gone, he comes out. There is a knock on the door. He hides in a filthy closet. When the gossip is gone, he comes out. There is a knock on the door....

778036.title: Female Rivals
778036.plot: A young couple appear to be perfectly happy and in love, but one day the woman discovers that her husband is having an affair. She seeks out his mistress, and the two women agree to resolve their conflict in a duel.

784938.title: Hawaiians Departing to Attend a "Luau" or Native Feast
784938.plot: A bunch of people traveling by foot or on horseback past the camera in Hawaii.

794052.title: The Wig Chase
794052.plot: Child prank causes chase for few ballons and one lady's wig

797933.title: Indian Washing the Baby
797933.plot: Two Indian women wash a baby with a jug of water, while a man with a turban sits behind them.

818430.title: The Riderless Bicycle
818430.plot: Short film showcasing a circus clown act.

822360.title: The Female Spy
822360.plot: A woman engages in espionage for an enemy army and suffers the consequences when she is caught.

827821.title: The Snapshot Fiend; or, Willie's New Camera
827821.plot: Catalogue in "The Big V: A History of the Vitagraph Company," by Anthony Slide & Alan Gevinson, 1987.

832621.title: Paris Slums
832621.plot: A criminal gang descends into the sewers of Paris and uses an interior exit to get their hands on a safe. They move it out of town, where they work to open it.

842620.title: Indian Scenes
842620.plot: This is, for 1906, a strikingly ambitious prototype-documentary travelogue filmed in and around the cities now called Kolkata and Mumbai. It's full of precious, occasionally startling images, from an extended 'phantom ride' down busy Calcutta streets to thronging port life, street trading, even the cremation of a human body and the ritual decapitation of lambs on a Bombay street – a scene some viewers may find upsetting.  This is a French production but, like many of the 'exotic' travel films so popular in early cinema, it travelled widely itself – hence this version, with English language intertitles.

844754.title: A Native Street in India
844754.plot: A street busy with pedestrians and animal-drawn carts is filmed from a static camera position. Many of the Indian men are naked to the waist, some carry loads, several men and women carry umbrellas against the sun. No Europeans are visible. To the left side of the street are stalls with awnings over (126ft)

871014.title: Scenes in San Francisco (No. 2)
871014.plot: Views and pans among the ruins of San Francisco after the earthquake and fire.

871015.title: Vanderbilt Cup 1906
871015.plot: A huge throng of spectators watches a car race.

871021.title: Panorama of Market Street, the City Hall, Taken from the Roof of the U.S. Mint
871021.plot: A camera starts on a sloppy scene: people walking around, a building that's seen better days, palm trees, with fronds waving in the breeze. As the camera pans to the left, the busy people continue, but the audience sees the devastation left by the San Francisco Earthquake.

871022.title: Shot for Looting
871022.plot: Despite the lurid title, no one gets shot in this long actuality from Lubin. Instead, it's another panorama, as indicated in the movie's alternative title, of the devastation wrought on San Francisco by the Earthquake and subsequent fire.

871023.title: The Mission
871023.plot: This Lubin actuality of the aftermath of the San Francisco Earthquake begins with a group of men, pans to the left, and the people vanish, leaving only the shattered landscape.

879633.title: The Arlberg Railway
879633.plot: An early silent showing the Arlberg Railway

879635.title: Fox Hunting
879635.plot: An early short about fox hunting

882043.title: At the Seaside
882043.plot: A man plays with three young women at the beach while his wife is alseep.

94702.title: Dream of a Rarebit Fiend
94702.plot: A live-action film adaptation of the comic strip Dream of the Rarebit Fiend by American cartoonist Winsor McCay.  This silent short film follows the established theme: the “Rarebit Fiend” gorges himself on rarebit and thus suffers spectacular hallucinatory dreams.

915898.title: Luzern und der Vierwaldstätter See
915898.plot: There are a lot of circular pans in this very long (for 1906) travelogue showing the waterfroot of Lucerne, followed by a long moving shot (taken from a boat, since the image rocks) to oe of the resorts on the lake. It's a portrait of a very prosperous bit of city and countryside.

916128.title: Boireau déménage
916128.plot: Andre Deed is moving out, so he has hired some guys with a cart to move his stuff...... and they have a drink to seal the deal. They load his cart...... and they have a drink..... in short, but the time this is over, Deed is pretty loaded too in this amusing comedy.

916131.title: Cache-toi dans la malle !
916131.plot: A woman receives her lover at home but the husband arrives having to hide him in a trunk. They go on a trip and the porters do not treat the trunk very well.

916162.title: Histoire d'un pantalon
916162.plot: When his wife gives to the ragman a pair of tan trousers in which all his money is kept, a man proceeds to rip the trousers off everyone he meets.

916194.title: La désespérée
916194.plot: About a woman thrown out after she has a child out of wedlock, with the usual "go and darken my doorstep no more!" gesture.

916200.title: La jeteuse de sorts
916200.plot: Picking at random, we see the angry mob of peasants attacking the witch's home with pitchforks and fire; the use of chapter heading titles (at least for the English language version I looked at ), and a rather languid approach to mob violence: they set the witch's house on fire, then do nothing while she strolls out of the place, past them, and to the river where she climbs into a boat and makes her exit, stage right.

916206.title: La scuola di cavalleria Tor di Quinto
916206.plot: Riders at a cavalry school take the horses through their paces, jumping over fences and walls, descending steep slopes, and fording streams. Some horses balk, and riders occasionally fall off their steeds.

916209.title: Le choix d'une bonne
916209.plot: This maid breaks the dishes, so it's off to the employment office. The next one tries on her mistress's clothes and gets kissed by the master, so it's back to the employment agency. The third...

916214.title: Le détective
916214.plot: A child and her nurse are out walking. A band of desperate men and women knock the nurse down and abduct the child. Soon a ransom note is sent to the parents. They hire a detective to pay the kidnappers off and rescue their child, although it turns out to involve a desperate chase.

916223.title: Les frères rivaux
916223.plot: When his father dies, two brothers inherit his property but because of a woman who loves one of them, the other becomes jealous and enmity arises.

916226.title: Les gaietés du divorce
916226.plot: There have been a lot of comedies about divorce, perhaps more than serious movies about the subject. This seems to be the earliest one I have seen/ As a result of its age, that makes it particularly simple in tone, taking pleasure in the argumentation.

916227.title: Les malheurs de Madame Durand
916227.plot: Madame Durand goes for a walk and is oblivious to practically everything. She ends up making a nuisance of herself again and again. It's so bad that she eventually even walks into an open sewer and falls down inside. She can't find her way out and wanders until she's overcome with fatigue. When she awakens, she has rats crawling on her! Eventually, despite herself, she is rescued and returns home....and you can only assume she learned absolutely nothing!

916231.title: Les malheurs de monsieur Ducornard
916231.plot: When the story begins, a man is called out of town after receiving some sort of letter. On his way to the train station, all sorts of problems happen. First, a man knocks him down and threatens him (you later find it is the wife's lover coming to see her as her husband leaves), his carriage loses a wheel, a group of women beat him up for no particular reason, he crashes into a table at a cafe and the patrons attack and much, much more. In the end, he misses his train and returns home...only to find burglars in his home and the pair tie him up. What could possibly happen next??

916233.title: Les mésaventures d'un tonneau
916233.plot: A drunk crawls into a barrel. Some boys push the barrel into the street, where it rolls hither and yon for five minutes of screen time, doubtless with the same scientific curiosity of people observing the old woman who swallowed a fly; we don't know why either started the whole process.

916234.title: Les six galants dragons
916234.plot: Half a dozen dragoons attempt to pick up half a dozen nursemaids in he park. Alas, officers come by. It happens again with some women out shopping, but even he officers are outranked when the husbands show up.

916239.title: Mésaventures de chasse
916239.plot: A man goes out duck hunting, but everything goes wrong, just like the title indicates.

916241.title: Parade des sultans
916241.plot: A slave dealer exhibits his wares to a wealthy guy in a turban.... and by that I mean he is showing off women by stripping their clothes from them.

916246.title: Pitou amoureux
916246.plot: Pitou get some leave, so he goes to see his girlfriend, the cook at a house. When her other boyfriend comes in, she makes Pitou hide in the coal bin/garbage can, with the typical results for a slapstick comedy.

916249.title: Refugees in Camp in Jefferson Square
916249.plot: After the San Francisco Earthquake knocked the city out, and the fires did more damage, many of the refugees from the devastated area settled in a tent city in Jefferson Square. Here are some images from that site.

916253.title: Richesse d'un jour
916253.plot: A rich man receives money and loses his wallet in a park. He finds her a tramp who begins to spend all the money with no sense, to lose everything.

916269.title: Trois sous de poireaux
916269.plot: A drunk man is going to buy more drink at his wife's expense, which he takes advantage of to get more drunk.

984069.title: The Scholar's Breakfast
984069.plot: After finding the butter on his bread to be off, a scholar examines the food under a microscope. This short film is from the Corrick Collection by the Corrick Family Entertainers.

1006098.title: Sheep Coming Through Chute, Humuula Ranch, Hawaii
1006098.plot: Sheep bound through a narrow opening, followed by a panoramic vista of the flock running through a meadow.

1037272.title: Solser and Hesse
1037272.plot: A sequel to the last film from 1900, a single one-act “talkie” sound on-disk film produced by the Royal Bioscope

1065343.title: Voyage of His Majesty to La Albufera.
1065343.plot: Spanish short documentary about King Alfonso XII's visit to La Albufera (Valencia).

1065344.title: Return of His Majesty from La Albufera
1065344.plot: Spanish short documentary about King Alfonso XII's return from his voyage to La Abufera (Valencia).

1078500.title: Un viaggio in una stella
1078500.plot: An old astronomer named Nigadimus has been transfixed by a star for a long time. He had but one thought: to travel to it, to declare his love for it! But how? A simple but ingenious solution-- A giant bubble. An Italian production, this is Velle's longer version of his own film for Pathé, released the same year-- On the same date. Uses many of the same sets, but different props, as well as a different ending.

1090781.title: Chemineau chemine
1090781.plot: An early example of trying to mix film with sound.

120015.title: The Birth, the Life and the Death of Christ
120015.plot: The stations of Christ's life are segmented into a series of performative tableaux.

120016.title: An Obstacle Course
120016.plot: A bunch of people run an obstacle course all around town.

120018.title: A Sticky Woman
120018.plot: A lady uses her maid to lick her stamps, when an overtly excited man notices the maid, forcibly kisses her, and they wind up stuck to each other.

120019.title: The Hierarchies of Love
120019.plot: A pretty maid is out walking and encounters a series of military men, starting with a private, who lose her to higher ranks.

120020.title: The Cruel Mother
120020.plot: A poor boy is mistreated by his mother when his father isn't looking.

120022.title: A Story Well Spun
120022.plot: A runaway barrel wreaks havoc all over the city.

120023.title: The Drunken Mattress
120023.plot: An alcoholic is inadvertently sewn into a mattress.

120024.title: The Parish Priest's Christmas
120024.plot: The parish priest looks to create a Nativity scene for his church, but his congregation is too poor to afford the statuary dealer's price for a statue of baby Jesus. The miracle, then, is that the faithful's prayers are answered by the appearance of angels and the Virgin Mary, who present them with a statue.

120025.title: The Truth Behind the Ape-Man
120025.plot: A balding man drinks a whole bottle of hair tonic. The unexpected surplus of hair promises a successful showbiz career for him and his wife.

120026.title: The Consequences of Feminism
120026.plot: It's a society in which gender roles are switched. Will men stand to be unequal?

120028.title: The Game-Keeper's Son
120028.plot: The kids of a game-keeper get into a chase with rifles.

128359.title: Magic Roses
128359.plot: A magician performs a magic show involving women turning into bouquets of roses. Later the roses are festooned together in a fancy way to decorate the stage.

132379.title: The '?' Motorist
132379.plot: A magical glowing white motorcar ignores policemen, drives up buildings, flies through outer space, and can transform into a horse and carriage.

134750.title: Humorous Phases of Funny Faces
134750.plot: A cartoonist draws faces and figures on a blackboard - and they come to life.

137757.title: The Merry Frolics of Satan
137757.plot: Two travellers are tormented by Satan from inn to inn and eventually experience a buggy ride through the heavens courtesy of the Devil before he takes one of them down to Hell and roasts him on a spit.

138730.title: The House of Ghosts
138730.plot: A group of travellers go into a house for protection. Little do they know, it is filled with ghosts who make unusual things happen to them.

139873.title: San Francisco Earthquake & Fire: April 18, 1906
139873.plot: Film showing the results of an earthquake in San Francisco on 18th April 1906 which caused great destruction.

144425.title: A Trip Down Market Street Before the Fire
144425.plot: A Trip Down Market Street is a 13-minute actuality film recorded by placing a movie camera on the front of a cable car as it travels down San Francisco’s Market Street. A virtual time capsule from over 100 years ago, the film shows many details of daily life in a major American city, including the transportation, fashions and architecture of the era. The film begins at 8th Street and continues eastward to the cable car turntable, at The Embarcadero, in front of the San Francisco Ferry Building. It was produced by the four Miles brothers: Harry, Herbert, Earle and Joe. Harry J. Miles cranked the Bell & Howell camera during the filming.
